msg:
add support for private IPv4 addresses (fixes #102)

Use public IPs only by default and fallback
to a single private IP in case we have no public IP.
Using public _and_ private IPv4 addresses at the same
time on a single host is not supported.

Fixes a bug where we created more than two
tor instances per public IPv4 address when the
host had private and public IPv4 addresses.

Variable 'tor_v4ips' can no longer be set since it is
potentially overwritten at runtime.

tor_maxips is replaced with tor_maxPublicIPs + tor_maxPrivateIPs

torrc: no longer include 'Address' line.

This would be simpler without bug ansible/ansible#14829 (#80).

remove task 'Check for local requirements' (fixes #96)

it does not work on macOS (the only platform it was written for)
including OS specific vars is always required (fixes #86)
bugfix: make conditional service reload after torrc change a handler (fixes #83)
Debian: allow "_" and "." in instance names, so our instances are started properly after package upgrade (fixes #72)
FreeBSD: change pidir from /var/run/tor to /var/run/tor-instances (fixes #62)
BSD: drop support for log files, change default DataDir location to avoid permission conflicts with the packages (fixes #59)

CentOS/Fedora: move DataDirs to /var/lib/tor-instances (fixes #58)

make sure SELinux type is set properly on /var/lib/tor-instances

allow the systemd service to write to /var/lib/tor-instances (drop-in)
Thanks to Jamie Nguyen for suggesting that fix.

log via syslog on Linux systems
Fedora: make use of systemd hardening features (also fixes #53 with RestartSec=1, thanks to Jamie Nguyen)
don't fail on CentOS with SELinux disabled (fixes #42)
OpenBSD: tor was not started appropriately with "-f config" during initial install due to an ordering issue (closes #34)
OpenBSD: fix a bug in openfiles-max handling (closes #37) Users of previous versions can remove the line "tordaemon::openfiles-max=13500::tc=daemon:" from their /etc/login.conf files

The {{ item }} variable is double quoted escaped, thus we need to escape them with double quotes for proper display.

  available in version >2.9. Using a manual loop do the trick and give
  the same result.

- Tested on 14.04

readd filebeat enabled variable

Fix filebeat checks

Update logrotate configuration

Thanks to @leanvel for the great research in Issue #170. I set the selinux type of the various data dirs to `var_log_t`. There's a number of options available, but after reading the docs that made the most sense.

Also, I found that `logrotate` is supposed to already have permission to send a `reload` to any systemd service unit. Our suricata service unit already maps this to the SIGHUP signal, so I swapped out this config to work within the existing confines of the selinux policy.

**NOTE**: Still need to test this, but I think it covers all the bases.

Fixes #170

Co-Authored-By: LeanVel <leanvel@users.noreply.github.com>

Upgrade nodejs dependency to 4.5.0 LTS to meet RC min requirements

  - Added 'rocket_chat_node_version' default w/ ver. 4.5.0
  - Change node-version-specific vars to be generic
    - i.e. rocket_chat_node_10_40_path -> rocket_chat_node_path
  - Updated README to reflect changes
  - Fixes #33

[qa] Fix Travis CI build errors #93

Travis CI builds for Debian 9, Debian 10, and
Fedora 28 have been fixed. Python3 is set as
the ansible_python_interpreter for Fedora 28
because it drops support for python-firewall
which is for Python2. Cron is also added to
resolve errors in Debian 10. Additionally,
cryptography from pip is installed to fix an
odd SSL error when installing django-redis on
Debian 9.

fix: make working command conditions on clean centos

Centos container don't have `which` command,
on Ubuntu `command -v` returns `command not exists` while playbook.

So, I'm using both commands.

Closes #8

fix: skip early compinit execute on Ubuntu

Closes #9
Fix typo resolves #55
Fixes #36

Fix #718 - change method of updating theme paths

After a deploy we were running `switch_theme` would had the side effect
of sometimes making sidebar widgets inactive.

This uses a simpler, more direct method of updating `stylesheet_root` and
`template_root` which should be less error-prone since it does less.

Fix #482 - Multisite is-installed deploy check

Optionally add the `--network` option to properly check if a site is
installed after deploys for both normal and multisite installs.

Ref: http://wp-cli.org/commands/core/is-installed/

Fix #353 - Allow insecure curl reqs for cron

In development with an https site, the curl command for WP cron will
fail due to the "insecure" self-signed certificate.

Adding the `-k` flag means curl will ignore this and continue on.

Fixes #374 - Remove composer vendor/bin from $PATH

Removing since it exposes a privilege escalation vulnerability.
